snippet: Hollywood, the railroad industry and rum producers benefited from some obscure provisions that survived the deal between the White House and Congress.
abstract: Congress's Joint Committee on Taxation says federal budget deal will extend bevy of corporate tax breaks and credits that had been scheduled to expire at end of 2012 for another year, costing taxpayers $46.1 billion over next decade; preservation of subsidies and deductions has become perennial Washington ritual in recent years.

byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and MATTHEW L. WALD

lead_paragraph: Hollywood, the railroad industry and rum producers benefited from some obscure provisions that survived the deal between the White House and Congress.

headline.main: Some Breaks for Industries Are Retained in Fiscal Deal
